text: according to Oxfam's latest report 62
people have more wealth than half the
world's population and the richest 1%
own as much as the rest of the world
combined
fat question marks have been raised over
how Oxfam determines wealth and poverty
the way it's looked at in this report is
the poorest people are those who have
more deep than assets so a recent
university graduate in a rich country
who has piles of student debt is defined
as one of the world's poorest others say
that the trend for income inequality
between countries is actually decreasing
as developing countries become richer it
is however rising within some countries
particularly the US and the UK where the
trend is for the income share of the
rich to increase and what do Oxfam think
needs to be done about the inequality
gap a crackdown on tax evasion according
to them the super-rich have stashed
seven point six trillion dollars in
offshore accounts
